title: As a librarian what issues have you come across to make libraries accessible for children with special educational needs? - Quora

response.answer_text: We have done many things to make our libraries accessable for everyone. This includes lighting studies to makes sure levels are comfortable for reading, tables and chairs designed for various levels of disability, and access to quiet spaces for when the level of activities becomes overwhelming fir neuro atypical children. The most important issue to address is training of staff. Our library staff are our most valuable resource and want to do whatever they can to help. Our leadership works hard to find the most current information so they know what is effective.
